00024 /* DL package logging classes */
00025 #define DSLOG_CLASSA   0x0001
00026 #define DSLOG_CLASSB   0x0002
00027 #define DSLOG_CLASSC   0x0004
00028 
00029 /* Timeout to use when waiting for incoming IPC traffic from API side */
00030 #define DSIPCTIMEOUT   0    /* wait forever */
00031 
00032 /* MM buffer pool definitions */
00033 #define DSIPCBUFSZ     2000 /* Size of an IPC Buffer - TBD tune later */
00034 #define DSIPCPOOLSZ    45   /* # of buffers in pool  - TBD tune later */
00035 
00036 /* Receive buffer size */
00037 #define DSRXPOOLSZ      5     /* # blocks in the pool */
00038 #define DSQQMIRXPOOLSZ  (QMI_SUPPORTED_CLNT_MAX - QMI_SUPPORTED_CLNT_MIN)
00039 
00040 /* EP buffer definitions */
00041 #define DSEPBUFSZ      4096 /* Size of an EP input Buffer */
00042

00044 #define DSEPSMLBUFSIZE 300     /* payload of each block in bytes */
00045 
00046 /* DS US task pause delay. Used when the modem disappears
00047  * and a call to usrcvtty() returns FALSE
00048  */
00049 #define DSRXSCANDELAY 1000  /* Delay in ms */

00051 /*************
00052  *
00053  * Name:    dsipccb
00054  *
00055  * Purpose: DS IPC Task control block structure
00056  *
00057  * Members:
00058  *          dsdlcb     - DL package control block for logging
00059  *          dsbufpool  - MM pool structure. Blocks in this pool are used
00060  *                       to store incoming data packets from the API
00061  *                       side
00062  *          dsrcvcbckp - pointer to IPC receive handler
00063  *                       IPC receive handler is installed when the
00064  *                       channel is opened with the following prototype:
00065  *              inipcmsgp - pointer to the beginning of the received message
00066  *              inmsglen  - length of the received message
00067  *              memfreep  - pointer to memory to be released by the callback
00068  *              ipcchannel  -IPC channel used for this service
00069  * Notes:   The DS IPC task runs on the SDK side only.
00070  *          This is a 'generic' DS IPC Task control block structure
00071  *          Several DS IPC Tasks may exist concurrently; each such task
00072  *          serves one IPC channel.
00073  *
00074  *
00075  **************/
00076 struct dsipccb
00077 {
00078     struct dlusercb  dsdlcb;
00079     struct mmpool    dsbufpool;
00080     void (*dsrcvcbckp)(swi_uint8 *inipcmsgp, swi_uint32 inmsglen,
00081         swi_uint8 *memfreep, swi_uint16 ipcchannel );
00082 };
00083 
00084 /*************
00085  * Name:    dsappipccb
00086  *
00087  * Purpose: DS Application-side IPC channel control block structure
00088  *
00089  * Members: dsipccbhdl   - IC package IPC channel control block
00090  *          dsnamep      - Pointer to a user-supplied name useful
00091  *                         for troubleshooting
00092  *          dschannel    - IPC channel number this instance of the
00093  *                         application side DS package is interacting
00094  *                         with
00095  *
00096  * Note:    The application side of the DS package interacts with
00097  *          IPC channels only, other device types are not currently
00098  *          supported
00099  *
00100  **************/
00101 struct dsappipccb {
00102     struct icipccb dsipccbhdl;
00103     swi_uint8 *dsnamep;
00104     swi_uint16 dschannel;
00105 };
00106 
00107 /*************
00108  * Name:    dsappcb
00109  *
00110  * Purpose: DS Application-side task control block structure
00111  *
00112  * Members: dsdxchancb   - array of CIMAXIPCCHAN IPC channel control blocks
00113  *
00114  * Note:    The application side of the DS package interacts with
00115  *          IPC channels only, other device types are not currently
00116  *          supported
00117  *
00118  **************/
00119 struct dsappcb
00120 {
00121     struct dsappipccb dsdxchancb[CIMAXIPCCHAN];
00122 };
00123 
00142 struct dsuscb {
00143     struct dlusercb     dsusdldcb;
00144     struct swi_oswaiter dsusdwaiter;
00145     struct mmpool       dsbufpool;
00146     swi_uint32          dsrxpktsdropped;
00147 };
